content.question: The function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="f of x equals x cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></math>. The application of the Mean Value Theorem to <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, 1 comma 3, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> guarantees a point in the interval <math alttext="open parenthesis, 1 comma 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> at which the slope of the line tangent to the graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is equal to which of the following?

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
